MED #210 Not Stopping at 107th

Train #210 scheduled to arrive Millennium Station at 8:14 AM, will not stop at 107th street due to a fire at the station. Passengers should use 111th street and 95th street/Chicago State University as alternates.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
Inbound Trains Stopped
Metra Electric inbound trains are currently stopped due to a station fire at 107th Street. Delay times are unknown.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/BNSF?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
BNSF 1203 Operational Change

Train #1203 scheduled to arrive Brookfield at 6:35 a.m., is on the move will terminate at Harlem. This train may be operating 40 to 45 minutes behind schedule. Train #1207 scheduled to arrive Fairview Avenue at 7:16 a.m. will accommodate commuters.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/SWS?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
SWS #804 stopped.
SWS #804 scheduled to arrive Chicago at 7:42 am is currently stopped due to a switch failure.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/BNSF?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
BNSF #1211 Operational Change

Train #1211 scheduled to depart Chicago at 6:25 AM, will express to Downers Grove then make all scheduled stops due to ongoing switch issues. Train #1207 will accommodate passengers. Please listen to platform announcements for delay times and locations.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/BNSF?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
BNSF #1213 and #1215 Not Operati

Trains #1213 scheduled to depart at 7:05 AM and #1215 scheduled to depart at 7:15 AM, will not operate due to earlier switch problems. Train #1217 scheduled to depart at 7:33 AM will accommodate passengers. Visit metra.com for schedule information.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/BNSF?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
BNSF Train Delays
Inbound and outbound trains may be operating up to 55 minutes behind schedule due to switch problems near Congress Park and Cicero. Crews are working to resolve the issue.  Updated at 6:57 a.m.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
Ground Level Boarding

Train #210 arriving Chicago at 8:15 a.m., may be loading from ground level at 75th, 83rd, 87th ,95th, 103rd, and 111th street stations. Please wait on the platform visible to the engineer and follow boarding instructions from the conductor.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
Trains Not Stopping at 107th str

Metra Electric trains will not stop at 107th street station until further notice due to a station fire. Passengers should board trains at 111th street and 95th street/Chicago State University until further notice. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME -  79th street/Chatham Station Closure Beginning July 10 - Station Rebuild Project.

The 79th street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, July 10 for approximately 9 months. During this time passengers can use 75th and 83rd street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, stations will have enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrances, lobbies with elevators, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage.  For more information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert - Metra Electric District Extra Service For Chicago Bears Games
The Metra Electric District will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for the Chicago Bears home games. For more information click here and visit metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N - Track construction at Grayland Station, Rondout and Everett crossing extended through June 2024

Track construction will be taking place at the Grayland station, Rondout, and the Everett crosssing has been extended through June, 2024. Trains may incur delays enroute up to 15 minutes behind schedule passing through the work zone until the work is complete. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. For additional information visit metra.com/constructionnotices.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert SWS - Oak Lawn Platform Rehabilitation

Beginning Saturday, September 9, the north half of Platform 2 (outbound platform) will be closed for rehabilitation. Once completed, the work will move to the south half of Platform 2 to complete the project by the end of November. Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-W -  Geneva Platform 2 Rehabilitation

On Monday, October 9, the Geneva outbound platform (Platform 2) will be closed for rehabilitation through the end of 2024. Commuters must use the temporary platform located east of Third Street.  Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Stairway Construction at University Park
Reconstruction of the stairs at the University Park station will begin in early November. Metra anticipates completion of the project by early 2024. Please exercise caution near the work zone.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert - Slippery rail season and how it affects train service

There's various reasons train service could be affected causing delays. During autumn months when leaves fall on tracks and a train's wheel crush them, a slick oily residue is left behind on the rail. This residue makes it harder for the train to get proper traction to start, stop, and maintain speed. As a result, delays may be experienced during your travel. Plan ahead and allow for extra travel time this autumn season. For additional info click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-W - West Chicago station repairs project - Beginning October 24

Beginning Tuesday, October 24, staton repairs will be taking place at the West Chicago Metra station. Work is scheduled for Monday through Friday from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM until the end of December 2023. Access to the parking lot and station platform will be maintained at all time, however access to the inside of the station could be limited at times.  Please allow additional time traveling to the station and exercise caution near the work zone.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric 103rd station to close November 20 - Full Reconstruction

As part of the Metra Electric Community Initiative to transform 13 stations on the district, the 103rd Street/Rosemoor station will be closed beginning November 20 for a full reconstruction. The station is expected to be closed 7 to 12 months. Durng this time, customers can use 107th Street and 95th Street/Chicago State University as alternatives. For additional information click here.
